Oxygen system would be really awesome!

I'll say this at the risk of getting shouted at by several people, but I think that omitting consumables in a space game is comparable to not adding enemies in an FPS game. I say this because you can still complete your goals in both games, but how much fun would an FPS with no enemies be? There would be no sense of urgency, strategy, or any kind of fun whatsoever in an FPS with no enemies, you'd just have to complete the mission by walking the whole way.

Obviously, this is an inaccurate comparison in many ways, as KSP is great fun already, and you can still complete your goals with a certain amount of challenge. But if something goes wrong, it would be good to see that "The [life support] went wrong, and we need to save them within two days! Quick!" as a time-orientated rescue mission would be far more immersive and rewarding if done correctly than one that you can just say 'oh, they can wait'. Therefore, consumables (A while ago I suggested having simple water tanks and food stores as the base modules, water being broken down into oxygen and waste hydrogen to keep the astronauts alive by some kind of power-requiring oxygen generator module - would keep the idea of 'fuel tanks' for the water and 'engines' for the water generators, just a different kind of fuel...

Scroll down a little

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/17318-kerbal-space-food
) are a key part of any space flight, manned or unmanned, and I feel that deciding against including them would be a step in the wrong direction for Squad. Even as an optional feature for, for example, difficulty settings, a consumables system would be invaluable to any space simulator, not to mention giving that ominous 'oxygen' button a function...

Done properly, with waste-recycling modules and things, I could see consumables not hindering any spacecraft designs by any great deal by requiring micromanagement (the systems could just be left to get on with it, unless they are damaged), and if the system was designed properly it would still allow for massive amounts of mission-time, and certainly not being detrimental to game play. (since life support is independant of ship environment, a 'time limit' readout could be given in the VAB before launch)

Features are added for gameplay value (I could be wrong), so therefore consumables (being an integral part of space-flight, far more so than EVAs, and on a level with guidance and propulsion), I feel, should be re-taken into consideration by the developers and certainly not dismissed as it appears to have been. Obviously, I have no say in what squad should do, and I'm trying desparately not to sound like "This is my idea and Squad are wrong", but I am entitled to my opinion, if anything.

EDIT:

in relation to Softweir's next post, I put my own ideas in the spoiler there, in the suggestions forum. Whether the developers ever venture there is, however, a mystery.
